body: Closing for now. Moving to local fork.
PS Just a note for public's and archive's sake that the saml stuff likely will be revised shortly to handle mappings better with richer pac4j support.
@coheigea Travis CI has passed, AppVeyor is quite unstable; please, go ahead and merge.
@ilgrosso  Done. Can you backmerge it?
@coheigea done, thx
@ilgrosso I updated the PR to pick up the other NOTICE files
@coheigea by looking at other years' similar commits I found the following file should be updated as well: `src/site/site.xml`
@ilgrosso Done! Could you backport to the older branches?
@coheigea sure
@mmoayyed it seems that installing other JDKs is failing, I tried to restart the related steps several times, no luck. Any idea?
@mmoayyed I'd say it works, please go ahead, squash and merge, thanks.
@mmoayyed any reason why you need this?

I would like `clean install -PskipTests`s to complete as quickly as possible, skipping as many tests as possible. It also seems strange that I can specify skipping tests, but in fact, only certain type of tests are skipped. Skipping tests should mean skipping tests, no surprises :)
I see, but when using `-PskipTests` IT Cases are already not executed, even without the change proposed in this PR.

hmmm, that's odd. I wonder if this may be caused by a conflict between the build and my local maven settings. I do see ITs run when I run with that profile, using `-PskipTests,all`. I will remove/reset local changes to try again. Will report back shortly.
This is so true that we use such profile for initial Travis CI step: https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/master/.travis.yml#L51
Tested again; Seems like I might have had some local profile changes messing up the build. Change is unnecessary as was pointed out. Closing. Thanks!
Sure. I'll do a sanity check.

@mmoayyed looks like you need to add something like as

```xml
          <testResource>
            <directory>${basedir}/../persistence-jpa/src/test/resources</directory>
            <filtering>true</filtering>
          </testResource>
```

to `persistence-jpa-json/pom.xml`

see https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/685613956#L778
This should be ready for another review. Test failures seem random.
Applied changes after review.
@mmoayyed it seems you have some trivial fixes to make, in order to allow ITs to succeed: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/694721332#L737-L738
Thanks @coheigea !
WA 6.3.0 SNAPSHOTs are now publishing. Resuming build/work on this to make CI pass, etc.
@mmoayyed it seems that there is only one IT failing: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/703950442#L741
@mmoayyed LGTM please go ahead, squash and merge
@mmoayyed maybe you missed https://github.com/apache/syncope/pull/197/files#r450679988 ?

It seems there are errors with IT:

* https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/706492140#L720
* https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/706492145#L859

@mmoayyed looks very nice, thanks!
Besides the small things noted above, would you mind, when merging, to add `SYNCOPE-1545` in the commit message? Thanks.
Certainly! Will do.
This looks somewhat stuck, closing and creating new one.
@mmoayyed it seems there are type troubles with XML: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/710281684#L703
@mmoayyed still errors with XML, it seems: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/710862476#L931

Sure. What would be a good substitute for the logic bounds?

```
class WAConfigLogic extends AbstractTransactionalLogic<WAConfigTO>
```

Can I use the following?

```
class WAConfigLogic extends AbstractTransactionalLogic<EntityTO>
```

@mmoayyed I see two options: one, the simpler, is what you suggest, e.g. extending `AbstractTransactionalLogic<EntityTO>`; the other is to define
```java 
public class WAConfigTO extends Attr implements EntityTO
```
@mmoayyed this PR looks good, but it seems there are issues with downloading transitive deps: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/726236247#L433
Thanks. I tweaked the pom publishing process a bit to include the required repos and looks like we are back in business here.
This looks to be passing. CI failures seem random/phantom to me.
@mmoayyed agree about CI
Sure. I'll make the adjustment shortly.
@mmoayyed it seems all IT runs are failing with same error: https://travis-ci.org/github/apache/syncope/jobs/732715336#L744 - could you please take a look?
Sure. Reviewing now.
@andrea-patricelli as said above, `docker/console/src/main/resources/console.properties.template` is missing

> @andrea-patricelli as said above, `docker/console/src/main/resources/console.properties.template` is missing

Added with last commit. Going to remove also blank lines

Tests seem to pass OK locally:

```
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------
[INFO]  T E S T S
[INFO] -------------------------------------------------------

[INFO] Running org.apache.syncope.fit.sra.OIDCSRAITCase

I'll let Travis run that job one more time, and if it continues to fail, I'll merge anyway. 

It might be worth looking at the CI configuration for that particular run/test and rethink it a bit. It does not seem all too reliable when it's run by Travis. Maybe even let Github Actions run that test in parallel?
@CapozXVII looks good now: let's wait for Travis CI to complete successfully, then I'll merge it; thanks again!
@CapozXVII it seems that at least one Console ITCase needs some changes, as Travis CI is failing on it: https://travis-ci.com/github/apache/syncope/builds/204120762#L6648

This looks to be ready.

Changes are:

- Had to add commons-codec dependency, since it was transitively pulled in by the saml2-idp module and provided via its "java-support" dependency. It's no longer made available since java-support was updated. Without this, pac4j-saml configuration fails to define idp/sp metadata for WA.

- Similar issues with okio. The okio dependency is pulled in by the duo module, which is really old and messes up the spring-cloud-config dependency.
@mmoayyed the changes look generally good to me: only, I'd either add `okio` to root `pom.xml` with version and remove version from `wa/starter/pom.xml`, or move both just to `wa/starter/pom.xml`

The  `skipTests` profile is not actually a "test profile", it is rather a way to get full build without running any actual test.
Naturally, not recommended for any check or even release process, but still useful.

For these reasons, I don't think it is indeed a good idea to skip copying legal files, as by doing so the produced artifacts will not be the same as with other profiles.
Makes sense. Thanks for the update.

@fmartelli would it be possible to:

1. open an improvement on JIRA describing the changes you want to apply
2. restore ordering of methods in `PGJPAJSONAnySearchDAO` so that it's easier to compare with current version?

Thanks!

I've just opened the improvement 
https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/SYNCOPE-1609

I am going to:

1. revert the changes on Console
2. change `ConnObjectTO` to bear, alongside with attributes, the FIQL query to uniquely identify the given object on the given External Resource; the idea is that such FIQL will generally be something like `__UID__==value` unless a `PushPolicy` with `PushCorrelationRule` is defined: in such cases it will be responsibility of the `PushCorrelationRule` implementation to generate the FIQL
3. change Console to use the FIQL from a given  `ConnObjectTO` instance to implement single pull
Thank you @DmitriyBrashevets
The next snapshot should be published in approx. 45mins. I will try to restart the CI process here again to make sure everything still passes.
LGTM too, good job!
Thank you @ilgrosso and @mat-ale
@mmoayyed I think a sub-task of SYNCOPE-1545 would be needed for this implementation, also to be used in this PR's title and final commit message.
Thanks much for the review! I'll take care of the sub-task and other changes.

@mmoayyed please merge latest changes from `master` to fix build with Payara.

About CAS / Pac4j upgrade, I am getting the same exceptions locally: https://github.com/apache/syncope/runs/2275643884?check_suite_focus=true#step:7:4202

It seems like the exceptions are due to the fact that xmlsectool ships with and leaks opensaml 4.0.1, whereas the configuration requires 4.1.0. I will play around with some exclusion rules to see what I can do. Alternatively, I might be able to force the opensaml version to use 4.1.0, which I think is likely the better option.

Fixed the exceptions locally. Further testing however shows that there are number of other issues regarding logout operations for SAML2 and OIDC. So, at the moment it's not feasible to upgrade to RC3, and I will work on fixes to make sure we can upgrade to RC4 in a few weeks. 

Changing PR to Draft status.
~~Still TODO: add a pre-defined `GROUP_OWNER` Role where to place the set of Entitlements to assign, rather than do it by code~~

thanks @DmitriyBrashevets !

I am going to cherry-pick on `master`
Yep exactly.
@coheigea please don't forget to cherry-pick this commit to branch `2_1_X` once merged, thanks.
@coheigea when you disable service listing, does doc page still works, a.k.a. /syncope/ which output is similar to http://syncope.apache.org/rest/2.1/index.html ?
Yes, it does, as does the WADL, openapi + Swagger links.

@andrea-patricelli it seems that Travis CI is failing at https://travis-ci.com/github/apache/syncope/builds/227158553#L6736

```
PullTaskITCase.remediationSinglePull:845 Should not arrive here
```

> @andrea-patricelli it seems that Travis CI is failing at https://travis-ci.com/github/apache/syncope/builds/227158553#L6736
> 
> ```
> PullTaskITCase.remediationSinglePull:845 Should not arrive here
> ```

I've  checked locally and reproduced the error, going to fix
@mmoayyed shouldn't pac4j be upgraded to 5.1.0 as well?
Good point on pac4j; thanks for the note. I upgraded it.

Update: I am working on fixing/diagnosing issues with OIDC/SAML2 tests. There are changes that need to be mad to handle dynamic issuers for OIDC, and almost none belong in the WA. The WA fixes are mostly sanitization of configuration, rather than any major changes, and I am hoping to finalize by early next week.

I would prefer to wait since the next RC would be out in a few days. I will probably do another merge with master right before the rc release to make sure everything runs ok and then we can merge this after the rc is out.
@mmoayyed thanks for taking care of such cleanup: would it be possible to remove the formatting changes from the PR?

@mmoayyed it seems that Travis CI is failing due to a JDK bug like https://stackoverflow.com/questions/54775253/jdk-11-0-2-compilation-fails-with-javac-npe-on-anonymous-parameterized-class-typ
Could you please have a look?

I don't think formatting changes can be undone, since the fix are not manually made and are a result of automated tools. If you wish to see the changes without formatting changes, you can use this link: https://github.com/apache/syncope/pull/279/files?w=1

Travis CI issues are the result of an old bug in JDK that has since been patches; nothing we can do without significant changes to the Travis CI which should be disabled anyway, since that is not the main CI and just creates extra unnecessary work.

@mmoayyed I see about formatting changes.

About Travis CI, instead, the checks done there are currently not performed with GitHub Actions (as they require Docker and might involve some work); hence, we cannot ATM disable Travis CI.

Github Actions natively supports Docker with almost no effort; so probably a better task would be to disable Travis CI and instead focus the effort to move the Travis CI tests over to GH actions, rather than maintaining two separate builds. I can certainly help with that.
@mmoayyed please see https://github.com/apache/syncope/pull/281

@mmoayyed would it be possible to remove the changes already submitted in #279 ? I don't quite realize what this PR is for.
Thanks!

I think the base branch I started off with was based on #279 . So once that is merged, then the "extra changes" here would automatically go away. If that PR is not merged/accepted, then I can surely rebase on top of the current master branch. The idea of this PR is to allow console to support the "JWT as Access Tokens" configuration option for OIDC RPs, both in the UI and the underlying models/TOs.
I see, thanks.
@mmoayyed please merge latest changes from `master` to get the updated GH actions setup
Merged with upstream, extra changes are now gone. I'll wait to see CI confirm changes/tests.

> Besides the comments I have added, there are two additional things to cover:
> 
> 1. run the tests for `core/persistence-jpa-json` will likely lead to failures, as the `MasterContent.xml` there was not updated

This has been solved.

> 2. at least a test case should be added in `ElasticSearchITCase` to cover the new features

I thought that, as per user search, just current Task IT test were enough, since we simply provide a new implementation for task search.
@DmitriyBrashevets please make the change in `org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.java.data.AbstractAnyDataBinder.setRealm(Any<?>, AnyPatch)` so that it applies to Users, Groups and Any Objects.

> @DmitriyBrashevets please apply similar changes to `GroupDataBinderImpl` and `AnyObjectDataBinderImpl`

For groups the provisioning works well when the realm is changed.

If the org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.java.data.AbstractAnyDataBinder#setRealm is executed after the before-projection is created then `org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.java.data.AbstractAnyDataBinder#propByRes` calculates resources correctly as there may be changes in the `org.apache.syncope.common.lib.to.AttrTO` with schema "__NAME__" because of connObjectLink.
This leads to a consistent behavior for UserDataBinder and GroupDataBinder.

So, I'd say that moving of the execution of `org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.java.data.AbstractAnyDataBinder#setRealm` below the creation of projections solves the issue. Please, look at: https://github.com/apache/syncope/blob/ad2523680b68e843cba35261c350521875f81945/core/provisioning-java/src/main/java/org/apache/syncope/core/provisioning/java/data/GroupDataBinderImpl.java#L203
Please, tell:
1. if `org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.java.data.AbstractAnyDataBinder.setRealm(Any<?>, AnyPatch)` still needs to be modfied and the explicit check for the realms should be added
2. if you're fine with moving of `org.apache.syncope.core.provisioning.java.data.AbstractAnyDataBinder#setRealm` below

@DmitriyBrashevets I understand that:

1. only moving the `setRealm()` invocation, with no further changes, fixes `UserDataBinderImpl`'s behavior
2. no issues with `GroupDataBInderImpl`

If these are correct, then please just apply the same change as (1) into `AnyObjectDataBinderImpl` and we should be all set, thanks.

> @DmitriyBrashevets I understand that:
> 
> 1. only moving the `setRealm()` invocation, with no further changes, fixes `UserDataBinderImpl`'s behavior
> 2. no issues with `GroupDataBInderImpl`
> 
> If these are correct, then please just apply the same change as (1) into `AnyObjectDataBinderImpl` and we should be all set, thanks.

The `AnyObjectDataBinderImpl`  doesn't require any changes the `setRealm()` is executed after the creation of the projection
Thanks for providing these very useful background information: without knowing exactly the context, I am already taking this approach in #287 , maybe not everywhere yet.

Sure. I updated the PR.

I think GH might be confused after the branch was merged with master. This branch was sync'd with master once, but it seems like GH does not recognize the changes as those that might already be merged with master.
Waiting for an answer to https://discuss.elastic.co/t/failure-with-sorts-and-new-co-elastic-clients-elasticsearch-java-client/291511
Will re-open later when CI changes have settled.
